source_text.description: A breakdown of the text source types in the dataset. Each label indicates whether it applies to the dataset, with supporting evidence from the paper.

Human-Generated.description: The text is entirely produced or captured by humans, e.g. original writing and human-performed translations.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the human-generated nature of the text is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the text is classified as human-generated.

Model-Generated.description: The text is synthetically produced by AI models, e.g. model-generated translations.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if this label applies to the dataset. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper where the model-generated nature of the text is stated or supported (e.g., 'Section 3.2').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the text is classified as model-generated.

Unknown Origin.description: The source of the text is not specified, not reported, or derived from web-crawl data with unclear provenance.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset includes text with unknown provenance. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper indicating the information of the text dataset (e.g., 'Appendix A').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the origin is considered unknown.

N/A.description: The dataset does not contain any text data.

is_applicable.description: Set to true if the dataset contains no text. If true, reference and reasoning must be provided.

reference.description: The location in the paper confirming that the dataset does not include text (e.g., 'Section 1.1').

reasoning.description: A justification based on the paper content explaining why the dataset is not applicable for text-based analysis.
